definitions: To descend or move to a lower position.
To be recorded or remembered in a particular way.
To be accepted or received in a particular way.
To decrease in amount, level, or intensity.
examples: The sun will go down soon.
It will go down in history.
The story didn't go down well.
What went down at the meeting?
The team went down by two points.
The ship went down in the storm.
